reference.shortdesc:
A figure group organizes segments within a figure.
Should this topic be located here in "Body elements," or should it be relocated to "Specialization elements?

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The figgroup element is useful primarily as a base for complex specializations, such as nestable groups of syntax within a syntax diagram. The figgroup element can nest; it also can contain multiple cross-references, footnotes, and keywords.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the figgroup can group content with associated metadata:
example.codeblock: <fig> <title>Sample complex figure</title> <figgroup> <data name="MetaItem" value="13"/> <data name="MetaThing" value="31"/> <ph>These elements are grouped with associated metadata</ph> </figgroup> </fig>
